argument.description: The length of the result after string has been right-padded.
The specified string to right-pad to string.

description: The PostgreSQL rpad function returns a string that is right-padded with a specified string to a certain length.
sample:
postgres=# SELECT rpad('techonthenet.com', 18, 'A');
        rpad
----------------------
 'techonthenet.comAA'
(1 row)

postgres=# SELECT rpad('techonthenet.com', 19, 'A');
        rpad
-----------------------
 'techonthenet.comAAA'
(1 row)

postgres=# SELECT rpad('abc', 6, ' ');
   rpad
----------
 'abc   '
(1 row)

postgres=# SELECT rpad('abc', 9, 'XYZ');
    rpad
-------------
 'abcXYZXYZ'
(1 row)

postgres=# SELECT rpad('abc', 10, 'XYZ');
    rpad
--------------
 'abcXYZXYZX'
(1 row)
